availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Massachusetts soldier. Middlesborough, Massachusetts, native. Married to Caroline Juliet Breck. Father of Samuel J. Breck. Graduate of United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, on July 1, 1855. Served in the Third Seminole War. Professor of Geography, History and Ethics at West Point. Served in the 1st United States Artillery as first lieutenant and captain from 1861 to 1862. Served in the U. S. Army under General Irvin McDowell as assistant adjutant general on November 29, 1861. Brevetted brigadier general on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, San Francisco County, San Francisco, Ward 8, p. 189.
John Fiske and James Grant Wilson, ed., Appleton's Cyclopædia of American Biography, vol. 1, p. 364.
James Lorenzo Bowen, "Brevet Brigadier General Samuel Breck," Massachusetts in the War, 1861-1865 (Springfield, Massachusetts: Clark W. Bryan and Company, 1889), p. 888–890.
